text:
He shared the story of his amazing body transformation, even being crowned Men’s Health Celebrity Man Of The Year after losing 13 kilograms.
But even the most committed of fitness fanatics need a bit of company sometimes, so on Friday, Larry Emdur and his wife Sylvie enjoyed a leisurely walk together around Bondi Beach in Sydney.
The 51-year-old Morning Show host looked healthy and happy as he strolled hand-in-hand with his lady love before storms ravaged the city.
Scroll down for video
Fit and fantastic at 51! Larry Emdur took a stroll hand-in-hand with his wife Sylvie around Bondi Beach on Friday
Wearing a grey marle v-neck T-shirt, Larry's prominent pectorals showed through the jersey cotton.
He opted for a pair of tan cargo shorts and navy Nike sneakers, shielding his eyes from the harsh sun with a pair of black aviator sunglasses.
Sylvie meanwhile wore a white v-neck T-shirt and flaunted her slim legs with a black frayed denim mini skirt.
She tied her raven locks up in a sporty ponytail and shaded her eyes with a pair of over-sized tortoiseshell sunglasses.
Looking buff: Wearing a grey marle v-neck T-shirt, Larry's prominent pectorals showed through the jersey cotton
Supportive: The 51-year-old said he made the decision to 'give Sylvie back the young, healthy boy that she married 20 years ago'
Last year, Larry decided that there was no time like the present to overhaul is lifestyle, saying that his wife was a big influence in his decision.
Speaking to Daily Mail Australia in March, the popular personality revealed what made him decide to pursue the body transformation.
'We were coming up to our 20th wedding anniversary and the idea was to give Sylvie back the young, healthy boy that she married 20 years ago. That was the start of it,' he said.
Sporty chic: Sylvie wore a white v-neck T-shirt and flaunted her slim legs with a black frayed denim mini skirt
Transformation: The Morning Show host was awarded Men’s Health Celebrity Man Of The Year after losing 13 kilograms in 2015
The television presenter also said credit is due to his supportive family, who have helped make his transformation possible.
Larry and his wife Sylvie have a 21-year-old son Jye and younger daughter Tia.
'I was stupid before because it's always been there for me. Sylvie doing the great food, Jye ever since he was a teenager doing the great training, and it just passed me by,' he admitted
'I wish I started when I was 35 or 40, but now I'm 50 it's 10 times harder but its good.'
